node.title: MacKenzie Scott says she won't disclose how much she donated
node.description: Scott, who is worth $59 billion, said she wants the focus to be on the charities rather than the size of her donations.

node.title: Better CEO apologizes for firing 900 workers via Zoom call
node.description: One worker said Zoom firing was a "kick in the gut," noting that mortgage firm had recently secured $750 million in new funding.

node.title: Medical illustrator depicts Black patients in drawings
node.description: Chidiebere Ibe, who is from Nigeria, began drawing medical illustrations​ – such as a fetus in a womb, lung conditions and eczema – of patients who are Black.

node.title: Democrats’ Dangerous Appetite for Eating Their Own
node.description: The party’s infighting and pessimism are just what Republicans savor.

node.title: Drug Company Settles with N.Y. for $200 Million in Sprawling Opioid Case
node.description: The agreement with Allergan, a company whose best-known product is Botox, is the latest settlement in the case jointly argued by New York State and two counties.

node.title: Josh Duggar Is Convicted of Downloading Child Sexual Abuse Imagery
node.description: Mr. Duggar, who gained celebrity on the TLC reality show “19 Kids and Counting,” faces a maximum penalty of 40 years in prison and $500,000 in fines.

node.title: Beautiful Photos Show Comet Leonard Passing Earth Before It Vanishes for 80,000 Years
node.description: The comet has been spotted flying through the night this month after it was discovered in January 2021.

node.title: IOC President Thomas Bach Says Media Should 'Respect' Peng Shuai's Wish for Privacy
node.description: "Why don't you respect Peng Shuai in this and let her decide where her priorities are," President of the International Olympic Committee Thomas Bach said.
